CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 3 (in case of expulsion to Tunisia);Violation of Art. 13;Violation of Art. 5-1;Violation of Art. 5-2;Violation of Art. 5-4;Violation of Art. 5-5;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and is currently being held in ORG in GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant became an active sympathiser of ORG , an illegal organisation in GPE . In DATE the organisation was renamed ORG . He was arrested and questioned by the police on various occasions . As a result of persecution by NORP security forces , the applicant left GPE in DATE and arrived in GPE , via GPE and GPE . In DATE he went to GPE and in DATE he returned to GPE .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant 's submissions , in DATE , when the applicant went to the NORP consulate in GPE , GPE , to renew his passport , he was detained and questioned by NORP officials there . Subsequently , he left GPE and arrived in GPE .
CARDINAL . DATE the applicant lived in the province of ORG without a residence permit .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested by officers from the ORG Branch of ORG within the context of a police operation conducted against ORG . On DATE he was transferred to the LOC police headquarters . On DATE ORG ordered his pre - trial detention .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE public prosecutor filed a bill of indictment with ORG , charging the applicant and CARDINAL others with membership of ORG . As regards the applicant , the public prosecutor noted that he was protected by another suspect , the person who was responsible for the ORG area , and gave LANGUAGE lessons to members of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held the first hearing on the merits of the case . During the hearing the applicant made statements to the effect that his asylum request had been rejected at DATE and he had been living in GPE for DATE . He further maintained that he had not been involved in the activities of ORG and that he could not return to GPE because he risked ill - treatment and the death penalty in his home country . At the end of the hearing , the court decided to release the applicant pending trial . The court however banned the applicant from leaving the country .
CARDINAL . According to the information in the case file , the criminal proceedings against the applicant are still pending before the first - instance court .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant reapplied to ORG High Commissioner for Refugees ( “ the ORG ” ) and requested to be recognised as a refugee .

CARDINAL . Following his release from pre - trial detention and prior to his placement in a foreigners ' admission and accommodation centre , on DATE the applicant was questioned by CARDINAL police officers at the foreigners ' department of the PERSON police headquarters . According to the document containing his statements , the applicant was informed that a procedure for his deportation had been initiated . He was then asked to make statements as to his application to the ORG . The applicant maintained that his lawyer had contacted the ORG on his behalf and that he had been interviewed by the ORG on DATE . The applicant further contended that he did not wish to be sent to GPE , as he risked the death penalty and ill - treatment in his country of origin .

CARDINAL . On DATE the director of the department responsible for foreigners , borders and asylum attached to the ORG requested the PERSON governor 's office to ensure the applicant 's removal from GPE . The applicant could not however be deported , on account of the decision of ORG banning him from leaving GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy director of the PERSON police headquarters requested ORG to annul its decision banning the applicant from leaving the country . He stated in his letter that the applicant had provoked others in the ORG and had started a protest by not accepting the meals served . The deputy director also noted that the applicant was a person liable to be deported under LAW no . CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was recognised as a refugee under the ORG mandate .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant made an official application to ORG for temporary asylum in GPE . He was interviewed by officials from ORG about his request CARDINAL , but has not been informed of the outcome of that interview .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE ORG set aside its decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG 's submissions , the procedure for the applicant 's deportation had been re - initiated following the decision of ORG of DATE . However , the procedure was suspended due to the application of the Rule CARDINAL measure . The Government maintained that the applicant had been living in GPE without seeking asylum . He had sought asylum only after it had been decided to remove him from GPE . His request for temporary asylum was rejected since he was a suspected ORG member and therefore his presence in GPE endangered national security and public order .

CARDINAL . According to a letter of DATE written by Mr PERSON , one of the founders and the chairman of ORG , the applicant is a member of ORG of GPE and would be at risk of imprisonment and torture if removed to GPE on account of his affiliation with that organisation .
CARDINAL . The applicant was placed in the anti - terrorist branch of the PERSON police headquarters following the decision of ORG dated DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was transferred to ORG and ORG , where he is currently being held .

CARDINAL . As regards the conditions in which he was kept in the PERSON and GPE facilities , the applicant submitted that in GPE he had been kept in a CARDINAL sq.m cell where there were CARDINAL benches of QUANTITY . He had to call the warders when he needed to go to the toilet . He was given a meal once a day and did not have the right to leave his cell . During his detention in GPE he had no access to his family or his lawyer . He therefore started a hunger strike , as a result of which he was allowed to see his lawyer CARDINAL times .

CARDINAL . As to the Kırklareli Foreigners ' Admission and Accommodation Centre , the applicant maintained that he had been held in a CARDINAL sq.m room with CARDINAL other detainees . He was provided with meals CARDINAL times a day . However , the food was of very poor quality . There was no drinkable water and therefore he was obliged to buy mineral water . He also noted that the detainees were not provided with any hygiene or cleaning products and that the warders had an aggressive attitude towards the detainees .
CARDINAL . The Government submitted that the applicant was held in satisfactory material conditions in ORG and ORG , where he was accommodated .
CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law and practice can be found in the case of GPE and GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE ) .
CARDINAL . A description of the situation of ORG members in GPE can be found in GPE v. GPE ( [ ORG ] ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ECHR DATE ... ) .
